book_description: Walk in Christ’s power, not law
book_overview: We have been saved by God, so live righteous lives before your earthly watchers.
ESV_summary: Paul wrote to the church in Colossae to fortify it against false teachers who might try to impose strict rules about eating and drinking and religious festivals. Paul shows the superiority of Christ over all human philosophies and traditions. He writes of Christ’s deity ("He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of all creation" [1:15]) and of the reconciliation he accomplished with his blood. He explains that the right way of living in this world is to focus on heavenly rather than earthly things. God’s chosen people must leave their sinful lives behind and live in a godly way, looking to Christ as the head of the church (1:18). Paul wrote while in prison, probably about the same time as he wrote to the Ephesians.
ESV_introduction: The Colossian letter is well known for its doctrine as well as for its brevity. In the letter, Paul insists upon the Lordship of Christ. Colossians has come under recent scrutiny because of its references, implied or actual, to incipient Gnosticism, a growing heresy in the Church.
chapter_1_description: Christ is supreme over all creation
chapter_1_overview: Paul, to the saints in Colossae. May you be filled with wisdom. The Son is the image of the invisible God. I make known the mystery.
chapter_1_summary: Paul begins with a greeting and expresses gratitude for the faith of the Colossians. He prays for them, asking God to fill them with knowledge and wisdom. Paul emphasizes the supremacy of Christ, describing Him as the image of the invisible God and the firstborn over all creation. He explains that through Christ, all things were created, and He holds everything together. Paul shares that believers have been rescued from the dominion of darkness and brought into the kingdom of the Son. He concludes the chapter by discussing his role as a servant of the Gospel and his struggles for the believers.
chapter_2_description: Alive in Christ, dead to the flesh
chapter_2_overview: Let no one deceive you. You were buried with Christ and also raised with him. Why do you follow rules that do not restrain the flesh?
chapter_2_summary: Paul warns the Colossians against false teachings and philosophies that distract from Christ. He emphasizes the fullness of God dwelling in Christ and encourages the believers to be rooted and built up in Him. Paul discusses the importance of being free from legalism and the traditions of men, reminding them that they have been made alive in Christ. He encourages them not to be judged regarding religious festivals or dietary laws, as these are shadows of what was to come.
chapter_3_description: Set your mind on things above
chapter_3_overview: Seek the things above. Your life is hidden with Christ in God. So put to death your worldliness. Do everything in the name of Jesus.
chapter_3_summary: Paul instructs the Colossians to set their minds on things above, not on earthly things. He emphasizes that they have died with Christ and their lives are hidden with Him. Paul encourages them to put to death their earthly nature, such as sexual immorality and anger, and to clothe themselves with compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience. He highlights the importance of love, which binds everything together in perfect unity. Paul also addresses household relationships, urging wives to submit to their husbands, husbands to love their wives, children to obey their parents, and slaves to serve their masters with sincerity.
chapter_4_overview: Devote yourselves to prayer. Let your speech be gracious. Tychicus will tell you our news. Aristarchus, Mark and Epaphras greet you.
chapter_4_summary: Paul provides final instructions and personal greetings. He encourages the Colossians to be devoted to prayer and to be watchful and thankful. Paul asks them to pray for him, that he may proclaim the Gospel clearly. He concludes with personal greetings to various individuals, including Aristarchus, Mark, and Luke. Paul emphasizes the importance of encouraging one another and sharing the message of Christ.
